Certainly! Here are some convincing arguments for why a company should allocate resources to prioritize ISV relationships:

1. ISVs have an established customer base: ISVs have already built a loyal customer base, which a new platform can tap into by partnering with them. This can result in an increase in adoption rates, as customers are more likely to try out and trust new platforms recommended by their existing software providers.
2. ISVs can help expand the reach of a platform: By partnering with multiple ISVs, a new platform can expand its reach to various industries and geographies. ISVs have deep knowledge and expertise in specific industries and can help promote the platform to potential clients.
3. ISVs can help reduce the time to market: Partnering with ISVs can help a new platform reduce the time to market by leveraging their existing integrations, technology, and expertise. This can help the new platform to quickly gain traction and establish itself as a reliable and trustworthy solution.
4. ISVs can provide access to additional resources and expertise: Partnering with ISVs can provide a new platform with access to additional resources and expertise, including software development, marketing, and technical support. This can help a new platform to scale up faster and more efficiently.
5. ISVs can help drive innovation: By partnering with ISVs, a new platform can leverage their innovative ideas and creativity, resulting in the creation of new solutions that meet the specific needs of customers.

In summary, by prioritizing ISV relationships, a company can benefit from established customer bases, expand its reach, reduce time to market, access additional resources and expertise, and drive innovation. These benefits can lead to increased adoption rates, greater customer satisfaction, and a stronger competitive advantage.
